data.title: Congressional District 2, AR
data.meta_description: In 2022, Congressional District 2, AR had a population of 751k people with a median age of 38.1 and a median household income of $60,314. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Congressional District 2, AR declined from 767,099 to 751,268, a −2.06% decrease and its median household income grew from $55,764 to $60,314, a 8.16% increase.
data.text:
In 2022, Congressional District 2, AR had a population of 751k people with a median age of 38.1 and a median household income of $60,314. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Congressional District 2, AR declined from 767,099 to 751,268, a −2.06% decrease and its median household income grew from $55,764 to $60,314, a 8.16% increase.

The 5 largest ethnic groups in Congressional District 2, AR are White (Non-Hispanic) (68.9%), Black or African American (Non-Hispanic) (20.6%), Two+ (Non-Hispanic) (3.4%), White (Hispanic) (2.11%), and Other (Hispanic) (1.68%).

5.87% of the households in Congressional District 2, AR reported speaking a non-English language at home as their primary shared language. This does not consider the potential multi-lingual nature of households, but only the primary self-reported language spoken by all members of the household.

Congressional District 2, AR is home to a population of 751k people, from which 97.8% are citizens. As of 2022, 3.81% of Congressional District 2, AR residents were born outside of the country (28.6k people).

In 2022, there were 3.34 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (518k people) in Congressional District 2, AR than any other race or ethnicity. There were 155k Black or African American (Non-Hispanic) and 25.5k Two+ (Non-Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

The most common non-English languages spoken as the primary langauge in households in Congressional District 2, AR are Spanish (25,581 households), Chinese (Incl. Mandarin, Cantonese) (2,150 households), and Tagalog (Incl. Filipino) (1,210 households).

As of 2022, 97.8% of Congressional District 2, AR residents were US citizens, which is higher than the national average of 93.5%. In 2021, the percentage of US citizens in Congressional District 2, AR was 97.5%, meaning that the rate of citizenship has been increasing.

The following chart shows US citizenship percentages in Congressional District 2, AR compared to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

In 2022, there were 3.34 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (518k people) in Congressional District 2, AR than any other race or ethnicity. There were 155k Black or African American (Non-Hispanic) and 25.5k Two+ (Non-Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

4.92% of the people in Congressional District 2, AR are hispanic (37k people).

The following chart shows the 7 races represented in Congressional District 2, AR as a share of the total population.

As of 2022, 3.81% of Congressional District 2, AR residents (28.6k people) were born outside of the United States, which is lower than the national average of 13.6%. In 2021, the percentage of foreign-born citizens in Congressional District 2, AR was 4.16%, meaning that the rate has been decreasing.

The following chart shows the percentage of foreign-born residents in Congressional District 2, AR compared to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

5.87% of the households in Congressional District 2, AR reported speaking a non-English language at home as their primary shared language, which is lower than the national average of 21.7%. This does not consider the potential multi-lingual nature of households, but only the primary self-reported language spoken by all members of the household.

In 2022, the most common non-English language spoken in households in Congressional District 2, AR was Spanish. 3.61% of the households in Congressional District 2, AR reported speaking Spanish at home as the primary shared language between all members living in the household.

The economy of Congressional District 2, AR employs 346k people. The largest industries in Congressional District 2, AR are Health Care & Social Assistance (62,181 people), Retail Trade (41,482 people), and Educational Services (31,738 people), and the highest paying industries are Mining, Quarrying, & Oil & Gas Extraction ($91,250), Utilities ($73,427), and Management of Companies & Enterprises ($72,719).

From 2021 to 2022, employment in Congressional District 2, AR declined at a rate of −2.74%, from 356k employees to 346k employees.

The most common employment sectors for those who live in Congressional District 2, AR, are Health Care & Social Assistance (62,181 people), Retail Trade (41,482 people), and Educational Services (31,738 people). This chart shows the share breakdown of the primary industries for residents of Congressional District 2, AR, though some of these residents may live in Congressional District 2, AR and work somewhere else. Census data is tagged to a residential address, not a work address.

As of February 2023, there are 1.35M people employed in Arkansas. This represents a 2.24% increase in employment when compared to February 2022.

Right after the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, during April 2020, a general dip can be seen across industry sectors, resulting in an overall decline in employment by 8.69%.

The following chart shows monthly employment numbers for each industry sector in Arkansas.

In the 2020 presidential election, the popular vote in Arkansas went to Donald J. Trump with 62.4% of the vote. The runner-up was Joseph R Biden Jr. (34.8%), followed by Jo Jorgensen (1.08%).

John Boozman and Tom Cotton are the senators currently representing the state of Arkansas. In the United States, senators are elected to 6-year terms with the terms for individual senators staggered.

Congressional District 2, AR is currently represented by French Hill in the U.S. house, and members of the House of Representives are elected to 2-year terms.

The median property value in Congressional District 2, AR was $184,100 in 2022, which is 0.653 times smaller than the national average of $281,900. Between 2021 and 2022 the median property value increased from $160,500 to $184,100, a 14.7% increase. The homeownership rate in Congressional District 2, AR is 64.3%, which is approximately the same as the national average of 64.8%.

People in Congressional District 2, AR have an average commute time of 23 minutes, and they drove alone to work. Car ownership in Congressional District 2, AR is approximately the same as the national average, with an average of 2 cars per household.

Median household income in Congressional District 2, AR is $60,314. In 2022, the tract with the highest Median Household Income in Congressional District 2, AR was Congressional District 3, AR with a value of $67,342, followed by Congressional District 2, AR and Congressional District 1, AR, with respective values of $60,314 and $49,729.

In 2022, the median household income of the 306k households in Congressional District 2, AR grew to $60,314 from the previous year's value of $55,764.

The following chart displays the households in Congressional District 2, AR distributed between a series of income buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households have an income in the $75k - $100k range.

In 2022, 80.8% of workers in Congressional District 2, AR drove alone to work, followed by those who carpooled to work (8.93%) and those who worked at home (7.44%).

The following chart shows the number of households using each mode of transportation over time, using a logarithmic scale on the y-axis to help better show variations in the smaller means of commuting.

Using averages, employees in Congressional District 2, AR have a shorter commute time (23 minutes) than the normal US worker (26.7 minutes). Additionally, 1.72% of the workforce in Congressional District 2, AR have "super commutes" in excess of 90 minutes.

The chart below shows how the median household income in Congressional District 2, AR compares to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

14.7% of the population for whom poverty status is determined in Congressional District 2, AR (108k out of 734k people) live below the poverty line, a number that is higher than the national average of 12.5%. The largest demographic living in poverty are Females 18 - 24, followed by Females 25 - 34 and then Females 55 - 64.

The most common racial or ethnic group living below the poverty line in Congressional District 2, AR is White, followed by Black and Hispanic.

The Census Bureau uses a set of money income thresholds that vary by family size and composition to determine who classifies as impoverished. If a family's total income is less than the family's threshold than that family and every individual in it is considered to be living in poverty.

In 2022, insured persons according to age ranges were distributed in 24.1% under 18 years, 21.8% between 18 and 34 years, 37.3% between 35 and 64 years, and 16.8% over 64 years.

By gender, of the total number of insured persons, 47.3% were men and 52.7% were women.

The following chart shows the number of people with health coverage by gender.
